Line 57: Line 57:
The phone has no physical buttons on the front, and instead features on-screen soft keys embedded into the system software. The 3.5mm headphone jack is located on the rear of the phone, and the camera is located in the centre of the rear side. The phone does not feature a [[microSD]] slot for storage expansion, and will be limited to 16GB/32GB internal storage depending on model.<ref>18 October 2011, [http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/18/samsung-galaxy-nexus-hands-on/ Samsung Galaxy Nexus with Ice Cream Sandwich hands-on], Engadget</ref>
The phone has no physical buttons on the front, and instead features on-screen soft keys embedded into the system software. The 3.5mm headphone jack is located on the rear of the phone, and the camera is located in the centre of the rear side. The phone does not feature a [[microSD]] slot for storage expansion, and will be limited to 16GB/32GB internal storage depending on model.<ref>18 October 2011, [http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/18/samsung-galaxy-nexus-hands-on/ Samsung Galaxy Nexus with Ice Cream Sandwich hands-on], Engadget</ref>

==Availability==
â
The Galaxy Nexus will be supported by [[NTT DoCoMo]] in Japan and Verizon Wireless in the United States.
+
The Galaxy Nexus is expected to be sold SIM-unlocked and hardware-unlocked and will be supported by the carrier [[NTT DoCoMo]] in Japan and Verizon Wireless in the United States.
